    • Method Detail

      • resizeStringToMaxWidthHTML

        public static java.lang.String resizeStringToMaxWidthHTML(java.awt.FontMetrics fontMetrics,
                                          java.lang.String strToResize,
                                          int maxWidth)
        Uses html-linebreaks ('
        ') to resize the given string so that its width is smaller than the given parameter maxWidth. Be careful!: the height of the string displayed in a component that is able to interpret html-tags will grow with every linebreak added to the string.
        Parameters:
        fontMetrics - - the FontMetrics used by the Component within the resulting string should be placed in. The FontMetrics can be achieved using the function Component.getGraphics().getFontMetric().
        strToResize - - The string that should be resized.
        maxWidth - - The width the string should not exceed.
        Returns:

      • resizeStringToMaxWidth
